oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Drug Interactions in the Bovine Animal
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Paul, John W.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: drug interactions
unexpected response
physiological processes
laboratory tests
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The subject of drug interactions should embrace at least three facets: (1) an interaction of two or more drugs resulting in an unexpected response; (2) an interaction of one or more drugs with physiological processes in the patient, often referred to as adverse reactions; (3) an interaction of one or more drugs with laboratory tests either in vivo as a result of the drug(s) altering physiological systems or in vitro as a result of the drug(s) interfering with the chemistry of the test.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1976; 84-88
